steps.SubText: The water should be around 200°F jfkdls;jafkdsaj;fkldsjakl;j
Grind on ${grindSize}

steps.StepTitle: Rinse your filter with hot water
steps.SubText: Dump the water out afterwatrds

steps.StepTitle: Put your coffee grounds in the filter
steps.SubText: Make sure the bed of grounds is level
Get ready to brew!
Enjoy!
Make sure to evenly wet the coffee grounds
We're letting the coffee release it's gas

Start pouring from the center in a circular motion working your way outwards then back inwards

 Repeat this pattern until you've added the proper amount of water

 If the water level gets too high take a break from pouring

 Try to avoid pouring on the walls of the filter and having coffee grounds stick above the water line

 Aim to finish pouring between 2:00 and 2:30

steps.StepTitle: Wait until the water level drops roughly an inch
steps.SubText: It's always a great time to have coffee!

steps.StepTitle: Pour until you've reached ${Math.floor(coffeeOutput * 29.57)}g of water
steps.SubText: Avoid hitting the walls of your filter

steps.StepTitle: Wait until the water stops dripping
steps.SubText: Stop the timer when it's finished
The water should be around 200°F
Grind on ${grindSize}

steps.StepTitle: Put your coffee grounds in the carafe
steps.SubText: Make sure the bed of grounds is level
Get ready to brew!

steps.StepTitle: Pour ${Math.floor(coffeeOutput*29.57)}g of water in the carafe
steps.SubText: Make sure to wet the grounds evenly
Just a few light stirs

steps.StepTitle: Place the lid on the carafe with the plunger up
steps.SubText: Do not push the plunger down yet
Stop and smell the roses
Press in one smooth motion

steps.StepTitle: Pour into mug of your choice
steps.SubText: Enjoy!
